page.title: 19THE FUTURE-SUTTON ST JAMES
page.content: We have tried to describe our village, almost all of which is included in our D - block, as a friendly, lively, yet very ordinary place. It is probably no different to many other fenland villages, except that we live here, and we think it very special. What will happen in the future ? Will all the cottages along the main street be demolished to make way for a new moterway linking Spalding, Peterborough and King's Lynn ? Will tower blocks be built to house the families ? No, all of this is very unlikely.We feel that Sutton St James will continue very much as it has always done.After all, the land will always be used to grow food.Perhaps less people will be involved in land work because of technological development.
